| HistoryText             = 
===Overview===
The '''Soviet Super-Soldiers''' (''Russian:'' Советские супер-солдаты) are a government sponsored team of extraordinary individuals with special abilities. They fight for the people of the [[Soviet Union]] and the [[Warsaw Pact (Earth-616)|Warsaw Pact]]. They were created to rival the [[American]] team the [[Avengers (Earth-616)|Avengers]].{{r|Incredible Hulk #258}}

===Events===
[[Piotr Phobos (Earth-616)|Professor Phobos]] was appointed head of the program to find and train their super-powered operatives. The [[Homo superior|mutant]] [[Mikhail Ursus (Earth-616)|Mikhail Ursus]] was the first trainee selected and became known as Ursa Major due to his ability to shape-shift into a large brown bear.{{r|Incredible Hulk #258}}

The next recruits to the team were the brother and sister mutants [[Laynia Petrovna (Earth-616)|Laynia Petrovna]] and [[Nikolai Krylenko (Earth-616)|Nikolai Krylenko]], who became Darkstar and Vanguard. [[Dimitri Bukharin (Earth-616)|Dmitri Bukharin, the fifth Crimson Dynamo]] joined the team to form the first roster of the Soviet Super-Soldiers.{{r|Iron Man #109}}

Later, the three mutants members decided to remove all ties to the Soviet government, and kicked the Crimson Dynamo out as he still worked for the [[Komitet Gosudarstvennoy Bezopasnosti (Earth-616)|KGB]].{{r|X-Men vs Avengers #1|4}}

The [[Kondrati Topolov (Earth-616)|Gremlin]] later joined the team while and wore the [[Titanium Man Armor]], but was killed on a mission.{{r|Rom #45}}{{r|Iron Man #229}}

The remaining mutant trio of Super-Soldiers were hunted to America and beaten into a collective coma by their replacements, the Supreme Soviets.{{r|Captain America #352}} Sometime later, the Super-Soldiers awakened and were absorbed into a group of mutant outcasts and exiles led by Father Alexei Garnoff, occasionally known as Siberforce.{{r|Soviet Super Soldiers #1}}

Eventually, Siberforce and the Supreme Soviets reformed under the new name the [[Winter Guard (Earth-616)|Winter Guard]] which reflected the current political climate in [[Russia]].{{r|Iron Man Vol 3 #10}}
